intro: Medinilla nervulosa, commonly known as the velvet tangerine or velvet leaf, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by birds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring partial shade and well-drained soil. Medinilla nervulosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and air-purifying properties.
